feed.title: Lareau Lab
feed.subtitle: The Lareau Laboratory for Computational and Translation Immunology is housed in the csBio Program at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York, NY.

entry.title: New paper on HHV-6 reactivation out today!

link.title: New paper on HHV-6 reactivation out today!

entry.content: Our paper describing HHV-6 reactivation in T cells, including therapeutic CAR T cells is online today. See Caleb’s tweetorial here and coverage from STAT News here.
entry.summary: Our paper describing HHV-6 reactivation in T cells, including therapeutic CAR T cells is online today. See Caleb’s tweetorial here and coverage from STAT News here.

entry.title: Arthur Chow, our first postdoc, joins!

link.title: Arthur Chow, our first postdoc, joins!

entry.content: Arthur Chow, PhD, joins the group as the lab’s first postdoctoral fellow! Arthur completed his PhD at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. He brings a wealth of experimental expertise and technical support from Kinzo, Ono, and Zuka. Welcome Arthur!
entry.summary: Arthur Chow, PhD, joins the group as the lab’s first postdoctoral fellow! Arthur completed his PhD at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. He brings a wealth of experimental expertise and technical support from Kinzo, Ono, and Zuka. Welcome Arthur!

entry.title: Sparkathon Emerging Leader, 2023
entry.content: Caleb participates in the SITC Sparkathon 2023 emerging leaders symposium in Chicago, IL. While at the conference, he received a Distinguished Young Investigator award from the organizers of the class. We’re excited to participate in the main conference in San Diego this November!
entry.summary: Caleb participates in the SITC Sparkathon 2023 emerging leaders symposium in Chicago, IL. While at the conference, he received a Distinguished Young Investigator award from the organizers of the class. We’re excited to participate in the main conference in San Diego this November!

entry.title: Lab++
entry.content: Benan Nalbant (Senior Research Technician) and Crystal Bass (Administrative Assistant II) join the lab as the first members! We’re so excited to have them in the group with us. Come join us!
entry.summary: Benan Nalbant (Senior Research Technician) and Crystal Bass (Administrative Assistant II) join the lab as the first members! We’re so excited to have them in the group with us. Come join us!

entry.title: Grand opening!
entry.content: The lab officially opens today at Memorial Sloan Kettering. Our official institute page can be found here. Come see our awesome window views out of the 11th floor of the Zuckerman Research Center on 68th Ave in NYC!
entry.summary: The lab officially opens today at Memorial Sloan Kettering. Our official institute page can be found here. Come see our awesome window views out of the 11th floor of the Zuckerman Research Center on 68th Ave in NYC!

entry.title: Human Cell Atlas General Meeting, 2023
entry.content: The lab joins the Human Cell Atlas General Meeting in Toronto, Canada. We are grateful to the organizers for the invitation to present!   :canada:
entry.summary: The lab joins the Human Cell Atlas General Meeting in Toronto, Canada. We are grateful to the organizers for the invitation to present! :canada:

entry.title: New paper out today on purifying selection of mtDNA

link.title: New paper out today on purifying selection of mtDNA

entry.content: Our work resolving purifying selection of pathogenic mtDNA in specific immune cells has been published in Nature Genetics! Check out our tweetorial here and a News and Views piece from colleagues at the Wellcome Centre for Mitochondrial Research summarizing the key points of this work.
entry.summary: Our work resolving purifying selection of pathogenic mtDNA in specific immune cells has been published in Nature Genetics! Check out our tweetorial here and a News and Views piece from colleagues at the Wellcome Centre for Mitochondrial Research summarizing the key points of this work.

entry.title: Emerging Leader in Computational Oncology
entry.content: Caleb is named an Emerging Leader in Computational Oncology by Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center! Awardees took place in a two day symposium in New York hosted by faculty in the Computational Oncology program.
entry.summary: Caleb is named an Emerging Leader in Computational Oncology by Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center! Awardees took place in a two day symposium in New York hosted by faculty in the Computational Oncology program.

entry.title: New preprint on synonymous mtDNA variation

link.title: New preprint on synonymous mtDNA variation

entry.content: A new preprint outlining a potential role for synonymous variation in the mitochondrial genome just dropped on bioRxiv! In brief, we provide new lines of evidence that synonymous variation in the mitochondrial genome may have a functional role due ot the limited tRNA pool requiring wobble-dependent translation. Check out a digest of the work in our twitter thread!
entry.summary: A new preprint outlining a potential role for synonymous variation in the mitochondrial genome just dropped on bioRxiv! In brief, we provide new lines of evidence that synonymous variation in the mitochondrial genome may have a functional role due ot the limited tRNA pool requiring wobble-dependent translation. Check out a digest of the work in our twitter thread!

entry.title: NHGRI Research Training Meeting
entry.content: Supported by the group’s K99/R00 Pathway to Independence Award, the lab attends the NHGRI Research Training and Career Development Annual Meeting in Salt Lake City, Utah.
entry.summary: Supported by the group’s K99/R00 Pathway to Independence Award, the lab attends the NHGRI Research Training and Career Development Annual Meeting in Salt Lake City, Utah.
